Name: Statue of Shepenwepet, Daughter of King Piankhi
Description: This statue represents Shepenwepet, the daughter of King Piankhi and a divine consort of Amun-Re. Shepenwepet stands with her left leg forward. She is wearing a wig covered by the vulture's wings and a uraeus, or royal cobra, on her forehead. On her head, there is a cylindrical modius. She is wearing a tight dress, the braces of which cover her chest, and a large Usekh collar. She holds the Menat, sacred necklace of Hathor, in her right hand and in her left hand, a lotus scepter.
